description.zh: 光纖是光纖通信及光電應用中非常重要的元件。在本課程裡，我們將先介紹光的基本概念、然後是光纖材料與製成技術、光纖結構與傳播原理、傳播特性與分析、非線性特性、和有關的系統與應用。其中所討論的標題包含：(1)電磁波傳播之回顧(2)平板波導(3)單階折射率光纖(4)光纖的特性與分析(5)漸階折射率光纖(6)光纖於光纖通信之應用(7)光纖感測器之介紹(8)光纖光柵之介紹
description.en: This course provides the basics of light propagation in fibers; these include fundamental waveguiding concepts, the influence of various fiber structures, material properties of light transmission, and related devices and systems. The following topics will be introduced:(1) Review of electromagnetic wave propagation, (2) Slab waveguides, (3) Optical fibers with single-step index profiles, (4) Loss and dispersion in optical fiber, (5) Nonlinear effects in fiber (I), (6) Nonlinear effects in fiber (II), (7) Introduction to fiber sensors, (8) Introduction to fiber gratings.

description.zh: 速寫是最古老、最容易、最快速的溝通方式之一，也是充滿希望的設計師及藝術家必備的絕技。藉由大量的植物寫生，提昇觀察能力並把線條練活，進而建立起掌控「形」的基本信心。接下來的靜物寫生著重整體的構圖關係，利用黑白灰的構圖原理，著眼在傳其「神」而不是傳其「形」。將前階段的單線練習，改作分塊、分面的線群練習。再接下來是人物肖像寫生練習。到此，線條的特質、比例的嚴謹皆要掌控，肖像對象的性別、年齡、特徵以及由內在而外顯的神韻，是畫者所要表達的。
description.en: Sketching is one of the oldest, easiest and quickest methods of communication and also one of the most important skills a hopeful designer and artist must master. The course begins with a lot of plants sketching that helps to enhance your observation and build up your confidence in mastering forms and shapes in order to make your sketches vivid. Next still life sketching focuses on the composition. You are encouraged to utilize the composition principle of black, white and gray, and emphasize more on the vividness than the form until you get rid of the habit of passive copying of the objects. Then you move from the previous linear sketching practice into facet sketching and then block sketching. At the end of the semester, you will practice human portrait sketching. Until now you should be able to handle not only the characteristics of the line and proportion, but also the gender, age, charm and expression of the model.

description.zh: 在目前資訊爆增的社會中，從事教學工作確實不是一件很輕鬆的工作。當今國內的教育方式是大量的資訊必須利用有限的時間，在指定的空間內，傳播給必須接受者。此一工作勢必要借助於相當妥善的媒介或手段才能做到。因此，從事教育工作者如何研究和運用適切的媒體來教學已成為不可忽視的課題。本課程的重點在介紹教學媒體的涵義、分類與功能、如何進行教學傳播，以及媒體教學的基本理論。 本課程擬培養之核心能力與指標： 2-1具備課程與教學設計能力。2-2具備善用教學策略進行有效教學之能力。2-3具備運用適切方法進行學習評量之能力。(各項指標內容請點連結詳閱了解)

description.zh: 本課程內容為介紹鋼構造建築物之基本特性，超高層鋼架及特殊空間鋼架之結構系統，使學生習得解決建築空間與結構型態之實務問題，其主要授課內容為：（1）鋼骨構架之特性，（2）於各種載重下鋼骨構材之行為，（3）鋼構架之變形能力與破壞機構，（4）超高層鋼架及特殊空間鋼架之結構系統，（5）消能裝置之特性及運用，（6）隔震、制震之現況及展望。
description.en: This course introduced the basic characteristics about steel structure, the structural systems and forms of hi-rise building and special indoor space, in order to provide students to learn the relation between architectural space and structural type, the course consists of (1)the characteristics of steel element,(2)behavior of steel element under variable loads,(3)deformation capacity and collapse mechanism of steel frame,(4)structural system of special indoor space,(5)the application and properties of energy dissipaters or mechanical dampers,(6)the view of base isolators and response control system of structures.

notes: 四建四和四創意四合開

description.zh: 無塵室之構成、恆溫恆溼控制、粉塵控制、過濾系統、環境測定、操作管理、針對電子工業之應用。
description.en: Clean room system, temperature and humidity control, particle control, filtering system, testing and measurement, operation and maintenance. This course focuses on the application in the electronic industry.

description.zh: 專題報告、專題演講、研究小組討論
description.en: Literature Study, Seminar, Group meeting.

description.zh: 專題報告、專題演講、研究小組討論。
description.en: Literature Study, Seminar, Group meeting.

description.zh: 本課程之目標為增進研究生之英文閱讀能力與寫作技巧。介紹英文科技論文的慣用語法、用字與閱讀技巧，並分析撰寫英文報告與學術論文之章法與組織要領。
description.en: Objective of this course is to improve reading ability and writing skill for graduate students. This course introduces grammar, terms and phrases that are frequently used in English technical articles. Structures of English essay and thesis will also be explained.

name.en: Special Topics on Characteristics of Polymers

description.zh: 介紹高分子分子結構、型態學、流變學、化學性質、熱性質、機械、電學及光學等特性之分析方法及實例。
description.en: This course will cover the examples of analysis of the mechanical, thermal, electrical, optical and chemical properties, and the structure, morphology, and rheology of polymers.

description.zh: 邀請校內外學者專家至校針對某一專長領域進行專題演講，讓學生藉由聽講及心得報告之寫作，開展視野，並與時代之脈動相契合。
description.en: Invited speakers from different disciplines give speech in their specialized area. Thus students can broaden their eyesight and also keep updating the technology and its applications of the generation.

description.zh: 本課程將簡介醫學基礎與臨床知識，並對目前臨床使用之生醫材料作廣泛的介紹，與現今生物科技相結合，激發學生對於基礎研究及臨床科學的創意與思考。涵蓋科別將以牙科、骨科及整型外科為主。
description.en: This course will introduce basic medical and clinical knowledge. Those biomaterials that have been clinically applied will be focused. The aim is to inspire students' innovation and thinking about clinical science, through combining concepts of biotechnology with biomedical knowledge. Dentistry and orthopedics will be the major departments summarized.

description.zh: 先修課程：負責教授同意．肇事之形成因素，重建之定義及過程，數學物理及動力學應用於肇事重建，了解車輛碰撞行為，肇事之理解認知及反應，肇事之動量功能原理應用．車速估算．及轉向過度修正，轎車．機車．行人．及卡車肇事重建．
description.en: Causes & Contributing Factor in traffic accident, Process of Traffic Accidetn Reconstruction, Apply Math. Physics and Dynamics in Traffic Accident Reconstruction., Understanding Vehicle Collision Behavior, Perception & Reaction in Traffic Accident, Principle of Momnetum、 Work and Energy、 Speed Estimates for Vehicle, Steering Over-correction in Traffic Accident, Vehicle-Pedestrian, Motorcycle and Heavy Truck Traffic Accident Reconstruction。

description.zh: 先修課程：負責教授同意。包括液滲檢測法、磁粉檢測法、放射線、超音波檢測法、中子射線、全像攝影檢測法等、針對各種檢測方法之原理、可靠度、靈敏度等作探討。
description.en: Liquid-Penetrant Examination, Magnetic Particle Examination, Radiographic Examination, Ultrasonic Examination, and other less common techniques. Physical Bases of Tests, Materials to which applicable, Calibration Standards, Reliability.

name.en: Machine Vision and Image Processing Algorithm

description.zh: 本課程主要介紹機器視覺之基本觀念與系統設計、組成機器視覺系統之元件 (攝影機、鏡頭及照明設備等)、重要之照像幾何學與立體測量法，同時介紹二位元影像處理、視覺對準法則、相機校正法、計算視覺與打光技術等重要基礎知識，配合影像處理演算法之介紹，使學員建立完整之機器視覺基礎與概念。(本課程參考麻省理工學院(MIT)之開放式課程)將包含下列主題:o 影像之形成 (Image Formation)o 視覺系統設計 (Vision System Design)o 移動中視覺 (Motion Vision)o 陰影成像法 (Shape from Shading)o 二位元影像處理 (Binary Image Processing)o 照像測量法 (Photogrammetry)o 立體影像 (Stereo Vision)o 對準法則 (Object Representation Alignment)o 相機校正法 (Camera Calibration)o 計算視覺 (Computational Vision)o 打光技術 (Optical Illumination)o 機器視覺之應用 (Applications to robotics and intelligent machine
description.en: This subject provides an introduction to the process of generating asymbolic description of an environment from an image and the fundamentals ofmachine vision and image processing techniques. Lectures include the followingtopics:※ The physics of image formation,※ Vision System Design,※ Motion vision,※ Recovering shapes from shading,※ Shape from Shading,※ Binary image processing,※ Photogrammetry,※ Stereo Vision,※ Object representation alignment,※ Camera Calibration,※ Computational vision,※ Optical Illumination,※ Applications to robotics and intelligent machine interactionTextbook:Horn, Berthold K. P., Robot Vision. Cambridge, MA: MIT Press/McGraw-Hill,March 1986. ISBN: 0262081598.

notes: 車輛所和自動化所合開

description.zh: 本課程所為研究所課程，內容包括狀態控間分析，頻域分析，現代數位控制理論分析及控制器設計，應用實例介紹。
description.en: This course is designed mainly for senior-graduate students. The objective of this course is to introduce some fundamental concepts of digital control, such as state space approach, frequency domain approach, and modern control theory. The design and applications of the digital controllers are also included.

description.zh: 本課程介紹有限元素分析法基本原理及其在各種工程問題上之應用。包含有限元素分析法之基本觀念，利用變分原理建立有限元素模式，形狀函數及等參數元素，一維問題：桿、桁架、樑及骨架等，二維問題：平面應力應變及板殼問題。三維問題：一般實體，有限元素分析之計算機程式處理，有限元素分析於動態問題之應用，相關有限元素分析套裝軟體簡介
description.en: Introduction to the finite element method and its application to engineering problems.  Topics include Variational Formulation and Finite Element Formulations, 1-D, 2-D and 3-D Element Shapes, Numerical Integration, Applications to dynamic problem and Introduction to Commercial Finite Element Programs.

notes: 約有7-10週在B05-1車輛系電腦教室上課【停開】

description.zh: 一維及多維穩定態熱傳導及非穩定態熱傳導、對流原理、強迫對流及自然對流經驗和實驗關係式、輻射熱傳遞、凝結與沸騰、熱交換器、熱傳遞中的特殊論題
description.en: Steady-State Conduction-One Dimension, Steady-State Conduction-Multiple Dimensions, Unsteady-State Conduction, Principles of Convection, Empirical and Practical Relations for Forced-Convection Heat Transfer, Natural- Convection Systems, Radiation Heat Transfer, Condensation and Boiling Heat Transfer, Heat Exchangers, Special Topics in Heat Transfer.

notes: 車輛所和職車輛所合開

description.zh: 每週三小時一學分的專業必修課，旨在教導碩一新生學習各種生化工程相關的實驗原理與操作技術，以增進學生在未來進行生化實驗研究的知識與技巧；此外，課程中安排工廠參觀實習，結合學術與產業，豐富學生視野，促進學生對產業界的瞭解。
description.en: The three-hour per week course is designed to teach the 1st year graduate students a variety of biochemical engineering principles and hands-on skills to strengthen their knowledge and skills of the field; The course comes with 1-2 visits to industrial plants to further enrich the students' understanding of the industrial process.

name.en: Introduction to Services and Technology Management

description.zh: 本課程包含2大部份，服務與創新管理及智慧財產權與科技法律。服務與創新管理旨在了解服務與創新管理之意義、方法與現況，內容包含服務之本質、創新之意義、服務與創新管理之方法、科技之應用、服務與創新管理現況介紹等。智慧財產權與科技法律旨在了解如何以智慧財產權來保護科技研發成果，內容包括智慧財產權法規介紹與專利運用策略實務。
description.en: This course contains two major parts, service and innovation management and Intellectual property and technology law. Service and innovation management is to demonstrate the definition, the methodologies and the state of the art of service and innovation management, including the nature of service, innovation, the tools for service and innovation management, technology application and current development of service and innovation management. Intellectual property and technology law is to demonstrate understanding how to protect R & D achievements with intellectual property rights. This course includes intellectual property laws and patent strategies practice.

notes: 業界教師資策會蕭淑玲組長共同授課

description.zh: 本課程主要邀請學術界或企業界的學者專家，從理論或實務的角度，經由演講介紹近代的服務與科技管理專題，促使學生更深入及廣面瞭解管理現狀或趨勢。
description.en: This seminar course invites guest speakers from well known companies to share their experiences of service and technology management and provide students the updated practices and management trends in the field.

description.zh: 期望學生對各種儲能材料(包括水溶液系統電池、非水溶液系統電池、鋰電池、超高電容器、儲氫合金等)基本認識，進而了解各種能源材料之電池應用、材料結構、合成與電化學特性。本課程內容含有: (1)課程簡介, (2)電化學基本原理與應用, (3)水溶液系統電池分類與應用,(4)非水溶液系統電池分類與應用, (5)鋰電池原理、反應機構、市場、應用、構造與製造流程, (6)鋰電池正極材料分類、材料結構、合成與應用, (7)鋰電池負極材料分類、材料結構、合成與應用, (8)電解液材料與高分子電池特性, (9)隔離膜材料功能與製作, (10)薄膜電池, (11)超高電容器材料原理與應用, (12)儲氫合金材料與應用
description.en: The aim of the "Energy Storage Material and Application" class is designed for students to get the basic understanding for the energy storage devices and materials. The energy storage devices contain the aqueous electrolyte system battery, non-aqueous electrolyte system battery, lithium battery, super capacitor and hydrogen storage alloy. The reaction mechanism, application, material structure and electrochemical property of energy storage devices are also studied in this class. The class includes :  1.Course troduction,2.Electrochemical Theory and Application,  3.Types and Applications for Aqueous System Battery , 4.Types and Applications for Non-Aqueous System Battery,  5.Theory, Reaction Mechanism, Market, Application, Structure and Process for Lithium Batteries,  6.Material Structure, Synthesis and Application of Various Cathode Materials, 7.Material Structure, Synthesis and Application of Various Anode Materials, 8.Electrolyte Material and Polymer Battery, etc.

description.zh: 本課程的授課內容如下：1.	木造技術發展史2.	2.磚造技術發展史3.	3.RC造技術發展史4.	4.鋼骨造技術發展史5.	混合構造技術發展史
description.en: The course content about followings:1.	Developmental history of wooden construction2.	Developmental history of brick construction3.	Developmental history of RC construction4.	Developmental history of steel construction5.	Developmental history of mixed construction

description.zh: 本課程介紹科技論文寫作與報告，課程內容包括科技論文寫作元素介紹(摘要、介紹、方法、結果、討論、結論)與撰寫方式，文獻搜尋與整理，報告與發表注意事項，以利環境所碩博士生應用於未來論文撰寫與成果發表。
description.en: This class focuses on the Introduction of major elements in technical writing, including abstract, introduction, research methods, results, discussion, and conclusion. Writing grammar, style, and methods to perform literature search and review are also introduced. The main aim of this course is enhancing the ability of graduate students in future thesis writing and research publication.

name.zh: 進階家具與室內設計(一)

description.zh: 藉由國內外設計競賽主題與產學合作設計案進行實際演練，著重於資料蒐集、商品分析、創新構想與成果表達之進階能力養成，期讓學生在國內外設計競賽舞台上展現光芒，在產學合作中習得實務經驗並獲致產業界肯定。因此本課程旨在以實際演練達成兼具創新性與商品化專業設計能力養成。
description.en: Advanced Furniture and Interior Design (I) educates students to identify and resolve design problems - innovatively and with sensitivity to the social, physical and ecological environment.  Students learn to analyze and solve diverse design problems from technical, aesthetic, social and ecological viewpoints. Students are given the resources to identify, expand and test personal and professional development through an intensive exploration of design ideas.  Innovation is stressed, along with the ability to refine formal design issues.  There are numerous opportunities for students to work with industry through corporate-sponsored studio projects and design competitions.

name.zh: 材料光學與技術含實習
name.en: Photophysic Science and Technology II: Practical Technology

description.zh: 白光LED在照明領域的應用愈來愈廣泛，不僅在顯示器及影像的應用上，又如結合螢光與太陽能電池之應用也值得重視討論，因此本堂課除將介紹相關資訊在課程中，並針對學生所提相關問題做指導。
description.en: The progress of the field of lighting using w-LEDs is remarkable. Moreover, the progress of not only displays but also imaging is also considerable. Combination of luminescence and solar cells is also noticed. Therefore, I would like to introduce hot news concerning photophysics in my lecture.Moreover, I will guide for proposals and questions from staffs and students to contribute the progress of Optoelectronic Department of NTUT.

description.zh: 講述色彩、表色系統、測色、色彩容許度、色差、色彩管理和電腦配色之基本概念，以及介紹染色顏料的種類以及顏料粒子、結構與其色澤牢度之關係。
description.en: Description of the basic concept of color, color-order system, color measurement, color tolerance, color difference, color control and computer for color matching. On the other hand, It introduces all kinds of pigments available in the market currently and its relationship between the particle size and chemical structure with the properties and colour of pigments.

description.zh: 本課程檢視受到廣泛使用的主要教育評鑑模式，並熟悉教育評鑑模式的取向與實用技術。
description.en: This course is designed to review the most widely used model for educational evaluation, to conversant with approach and utility technique of evaluation models.

name.en: Instructional Strategies for Technical- Vocational Education

description.zh: 身為一名專業教師，應對教學策略有深刻的瞭解，方能詳細考慮各項條件﹑採取適切的教學策略，提昇教學的成效。本課程之開設，即在使學習者熟悉教學策略的意義﹑教學策略的類型，提昇教學相關理念，並進一步應用所學，反思個人的教學，促進教學理論與教學實踐間的連結。
description.en: The course is designed to make the graduate understand the basic concept of instruction, to realize the various strategies for instruction in technical-vocational education, and to know how to apply and evaluate the strategies.

description.zh: 組織行為是採用分析的方法，了解研究解個體行為在個人、團體、組織三個層次中的行為表現，並應用相關學理知識提高組織效能，尤其將焦點放在如何提高員工的生產力、降低離職率與曠職率，增加滿意度等四個變項上。
description.en: Organizational behavior (OB) is a field of research that investigates the impact that individuals, groups, and structure have on behavior within an organization, and then it applies that knowledge to make organizations work more effectively.  Specifically, OB focuses on how to improve productivity, reduce absenteeism and turnover, and increase employee citizenship and job satisfaction.

description.zh: 本課程精選有關教育與文化之文章，引導學生從閱讀中印證，比較各種文化和教育現象，並鼓勵學生從各種不同角度蒐集資料，俾使課堂討論呈現時代性與多元化的觀點。
description.en: This course is intended to help students develop their English proficiency through readings and discussions on discourses of education and culture.  Students are encouraged to react to the experiences described, relate them to their own lives and express their feelings and thoughts through interactive speaking activities.

name.zh: 高階英文字彙習得與應用
name.en: The Acquisition and Application of Advanced English Lexical Use

description.zh: 此課程旨在協助學生建立相當於美國大學入學測驗的高階字彙，亦即相當於接受高等教育之英語系國家人士所具備的用字能力。此課程將通過故事方式介紹此類字彙，其中也包括字形學之解析。學生修習此課程後應能將高階字彙使用於正確的上下文中，因此可達成下列諸目的："	提昇高階字彙數量"	加強英文閱讀能力"	習得重要字源解析"	避免上下文中的用字錯誤"	提高英語表達能力"	加強英文寫作能力"	精進英語文溝通技巧
description.en: This course aims to help students build a more powerful vocabulary on the SAT (the qualifying exam for US college admission) level, i.e. the level of proficiency of an educated native speaker's. Students will be introduced to the lexical use through story scenes. Morphological analysis of the words will be included in the course. At the exit of this course, students are expected to use them in their proper contexts and hence reach the following goals:"	Develop a powerful vocabulary"	Improve reading skills"	Learn important word roots"	Avoid word usage error in context"	Become a better speaker"	Strengthen his/her writing ability"	Improve communication skills

name.en: World Literatures and Cultures in English

description.zh: 本課程旨在藉由各種文化媒體（如文學作品，書報雜誌，期刊論文，電影等影音文字）引導學生選擇性地認識英國、愛爾蘭、美國、加拿大、非洲、澳洲、紐西蘭、印度、巴基斯坦、新加坡、香港、菲律賓、加勒比海等國家或地區的文學與文化。藉由認識上述這些國家或地區的英語文學與文化，擴展學生英語文應用的宏觀視野，並使之具備促進異國情感及文化交流的能力。
description.en: This course aims to introduce students to the selected literatures and cultures of English-speaking countries and areas such as England, Ireland, the United States, Canada, Anglophone Africa, Australia, New Zealand, India, Pakistan, Singapore, Hong Kong, the Philippines, and the Caribbean. In this course, world literatures in English, together with various cultural media (including newspaper, magazine and journal articles as well as Internet materials and films), will be examined to introduce students to Anglophone literatures and cultures. Students are expected to acquire via this course a nuanced, discriminating literary and cultural competency. With this cross-cultural literacy, they could help promote international understanding and global cultural exchange.

description.zh: 本課程著重分析中英文之句型, 語法, 慣用語等表達方式及比較其異同之處,並以密集練習及詳細解說交替, 使學生在兩種語言思考間運用自如。
description.en: This course focuses on the presentation of basic syntax, common expression, sentence structure, and an analytical comparison between the methodologies of English and Chinese translation, accompanied with frequent writing practice on students' part.

name.zh: 小說起源與十八世紀小說
name.en: Rise of the Novel and Eighteenth-Century Works

description.zh: 十八世紀小說的興起讓文學歷史進入了一個新的時代。有別於以往的文學作品與作家，十八世紀小說家以更"寫實"的角度表達他們對於社會的關懷。本課程旨在探討十八世紀小說文類的發展，並以Daniel Defoe, Henry Fielding以及Samuel Richardson等重要小說家的作品為探討重心，除了文本的研究之外，並輔以理論解析，以期幫助學生對於寫實小說之起源有更深入的了解。本課程將閱讀的文類包含小說、散文以及政論小冊，在文本閱讀以外，促使十八世紀小說興起的文化背景亦會是課程重點之一。
description.en: Justification:The rise of the novel in the eighteenth century introduced a new era in literary history. Different from the authors / literary works in the past, eighteenth-century writers tried to express their concerns of the society in more "realistic" ways. This course aims to examine the development of the genre with the focus on the works of eighteenth-century important novelists: Daniel Defoe, Henry Fielding, and Samuel Richardson. The emphasis of the course will be a direct investigation of literary texts along with theoretical interpretations. The hope is to help the students further their knowledge about realistic novel/narrative at its source.Methodology: Texts to be studied include novels, prose and pamphlet essays. In addition to the texts, students will be expected to learn more about cultural and contextual issues that influenced the emergence of the novel.

name.zh: 文學與批判理論應用專題
name.en: Special Topic in Literary and Critical Theory

description.zh: 課程旨在以跨領域的思考方法，融合文學與批判理論，探討特定主題如何在作品中呈現，思考在不同文化背景和歷史脈絡中的意義，以訓練學生運用和整合在其他學科，甚至其他學術領域學到的能力：諸如藝術和文學風格，社會和哲學思潮等。透過對文本（文學、電影、和其他藝術領域）的細讀和理論的思考和運用，學生可進一步應用跨領域專題研究的方法。可能的專題包括：文學與復仇文化、文學與音樂、電影中的愛與慾、文學與哲學等。
description.en: This course focuses on a chosen theme in literary and cultural studies, aiming to train our graduate's ability to investigate, both textually and theoretically, a theme in cultural productions in a comparative mode. Integrating the knowledge and insights students have acquired in other courses on artistic styles, social, and philosophical treads in a given period, this course approaches literature comparatively. In the process of examining what a particular theme means across history, students should acquire techniques important throughout their postgraduate studies. Possible themes include: Literature and Revenge, Literature and Music, Love and Desire in Cinema, Literature and Philosophy, etc.

description.zh: 本課程提供所有博士生共同參與研究討論的園地。將進行設計專題報告、專題演講、研究小組討論。
description.en: This course is a joint seminar for all the doctoral students, which will be progressed by paper presentation of special topics on design issues, giving lectures, and group meeting.

name.en: Literature Research in Design and Research Strategy

description.zh: 講授設計相關學術研究的基本特質與科學方法的傳統。本課程旨在介紹蒐集研究資料的方法、文獻探討的方法與策略，並探討各種研究方法的特質與限制，引導學生以策略性的思考進行文獻探討並架構適當的設計研究策略，進而得以研擬具可行性的研究計劃。
description.en: Lecture on theories of academic research and characteristic of science approaches in research. This course focuses on conducting an design research and presenting learners with a variety of research methods. Through the classes, this course aims to conduct individuals through the process of (1) strategic literature research, (2) constructing proper research strategies and finally (3) organize feasible research plans.

description.zh: 城市是有機體，是文明的象徵，更是文化薈萃的結點，因此城市的文化內涵、生活百態、環境紋理、經濟發展、社會互動與城市治理及發展規劃息息相關。經由實證研究得知城市轉型是是國家現代化過程中的必然現象與必須面對的問題，亦即如何由傳統社會走向現代化社會、從農業社會走向資訊化社會、從封閉型社會走向開放型社會的變遷和文化發展的挑戰。這些挑戰與城市文化內涵、產業經濟空間規劃及都市治理模式息息相關。先進國家常以創意城市作為城市再生與轉型的契機，藉由城市再生的整體創意與創新策略，將產業創新與文化創意作為環境再造、產業再結構、治理機制調適、公共設施服務與社會活力的內涵，藉以振興產業及強化競爭力。本課程以產業創新及城市創意為主軸，內容將包括研究創意城市的理論與實務，如定義、特徵、條件、構成、指標、類型、評估的基礎認識，進而探討與產業創新、城市發展規劃的關連，並參考國內外案例，研析其優缺點及自省我們的境況與條件，最後經由課程互動，研討可供我們借鏡的可能方向與作法。
description.en: The city is an organism, a symbol of civilization and the cultural nodes. Thus the city's cultural connotations, life styles, environmental textures, economic development, social interaction, which are closely related to urban governance and development planning. Through empirical research, urban transformation is an inevitable phenomenon in the country's modernization process. That is challenges from a traditional society to modern society, from an agricultural society to an information society, from the closed society towards an open society, which are closely related to urban culture, spatial planning of industrial economy and urban governance.For some advanced countries, they have been trying to reach creative cities as the opportunities of urban regenerations and transformations. They aim to revive the industry and strengthen competitiveness by the way of overall creativity and innovation strategies of urban regeneration, environmental improvement, industrial restructuring, the

description.zh: 本課程旨在培養學生成為具有深度文化視覺的科技人。從認識本土文化為起點，進而認識世界文化。引導學生如何探究文化現象，並且深入文化的精神境界，物質境界，瞭解文化價值與文化傳統，讓文化觀點充分融入個人的思維內涵。
description.en: The main purpose of this course is to develop the cultural cultivation of our technology majored students. Starting with the culture of our own land and extending to world-wide culture. The teachers would guide the students to explore the phenomena of the culture, and try to find out both the spirit and the material of the culture. Through the understanding of the worth and the tradition of the culture, the students might merge the cultural cultivation into their personal thinking.

description.zh: 本課程旨在培養學生成為具有豐富文學素養的科技人。引導學生如何探索文學作品，認識各種不同類型文學作品的發展歷程，以及每個重要發展階段的寫作理念，指標作家與作品。課程中將探討東西方古今詩詞、散文、小說、戲劇等文學類型的特點，透過分析作品，解讀作品，奠立遨遊世界文學堂奧的基礎。
description.en: The main purpose of this course is to enrich the literary taste of our technology majored students. The teachers would guide the students to explore the master pieces in the literary world, to know the different types of works with their development, and also the main writing theory in each period. Of course, the representative writers and their works would be introduced. During the course, regardless of the characters of western, east or ancient, modern literature, including poem, essay, novel and drama, would all be discussed. Through the internalization and reading the articles, the students might lay a foundation in the grand universal literary world.

description.zh: 以視覺藝術為探討重點，研究藝術起源以及原始美術、民俗與大眾藝術分野。探究式覺元素和設計原理以及應用媒材、使用技巧，涵蓋素描、水彩、油畫、版畫、混合媒材、雕塑、建築，廣告、包裝、服裝設計、工業產品設計及攝影等。配合幻燈教學，使同學對於視覺藝術有整體性、概括性的認識，以奠定將來從事藝術鑑賞和研究創造之基礎。
description.en: The focus of this course is the exploration of visual arts.  Students will study the origin of art and the distinction among primitive art, folk and popular art. This course also provides students with visual elements, design principles, applied media material, and techniques including charcoal drawing, water-colored painting, oil painting, graphic art, compound material, sculpture, architecture, advertisement, packaging, fashion design, industrial design, and photography. Slide teaching is adopted to give students a comprehensive and general understanding on visual art in order to foster students to appreciate, study, and create art.

description.zh: 本課程的重點在於闡述管理學之基本概念，主要的內容涵蓋四個領域：(1)瞭解管理學之理論與相關學者之研究報告；(2)討論企業界管理應用實務案例；(3)探討多國化管理之趨勢與差異(4)如何落實管理理論研討與趨勢。另外介紹現代管理相關功能實務應用案例。
description.en: The purpose of Management has four distinct objectives：(1)to introduce a new management paradigm；(2)to effectively combine the basic concepts of management and organizational behavior into a single volume, including the management functional and departmental descriptions；(3)to discuss business management applications in practice and ；(4)to effectively implement the management basic ideas. The planning, organization, decision, leadership and monitoring among variety culture will be covered and discussed in the class as well.

description.zh: 經濟學重視邏輯與嚴謹推理的理性特質是其主要特色，此亦為理工科系人之專長優勢，然而僅偏重左腦訓練的人才往往讓人覺得生冷機械，對事物看法也常過於直接而缺乏人情，若能在不失理性效率之下，兼顧以人為本之社會人文感性關懷，則經濟學自無愧為社會科學之母，其訓練目標亦與通識教育的人格均衡發展目的一致！為避免陷入一般經濟教學因理論工具比重過高而失焦，導致學生學習興趣驟減以致成效不彰，本課程重點在於先讓學生擁有強烈之學習動機，接著認知到"確立學習目的"的重要性，藉由生活實例直接帶領學生面對並感受問題，從而引導出經濟學切入問題的思維方式，並傳授其正確可行的學習態度與方法，同時提醒學生維持對專業知識批判的精神，在嚴謹訓練架構下督促其尋求感性的意涵，因而不致陷入經濟工具與名詞的浩瀚泥沼中，從而漸進體會出經濟學之精髓。
description.en: The science of economics is characterized by logics and cautious reasoning-at which most of the students of natural science and technology are good at. It is also a fact that those who take better advantage of the right brain are very likely to be straightforward and thus seemingly more mechanical and unsympathetic. Economics can be seen as the mother of science under the condition that rational efficiency-as well as the socially humanity--are kept at the same time. As a matter of act, the economic trainings share the same goal as what is required by the General Education courses.The first priority of the course is to highly motivate the students in the economic issues. We do our best to avoid too much weight generally put into teaching economics, leading to poor learning and teaching experience. Cases are studied in such a way that students will recognize the "real purpose of studying."  Real cases and examples are brought into discussion. We guide the students to"feel"the problems.

description.zh: 此門課程主要在於瞭解社會學的意涵，並藉由跨領域的學習，讓不同學科能有對話的空間。課程涵蓋的範圍會兼顧理論與實用性，讓學生能思考當今的社會，理解到產生因素的多元性，並進而使個人眼界能更加開拓。期望學生於課程學習中能夠擁有更多對於整個社會的不同思維，以強化本身學科之所需，不但具有理論性深入的洞察力，也能引用到管理上實質的層面。
description.en: The purpose of this course is to understand sociology. It covers theory and practicability, and make students consider the current society, and understand the generated factors of diversity . Expect students' study can have more for the community as a whole different way of thinking, in order to strengthen their academic needs, not only has the theoretical depth of insight, but also on the substance applied to the management level.

description.zh: 經濟學重視邏輯與嚴謹推理的理性特質是其主要特色，此亦為理工科系人之專長優勢，然而僅偏重左腦訓練的人才往往讓人覺得生冷機械，對事物看法也常過於直接而缺乏人情，若能在不失理性效率之下，兼顧以人為本之社會人文感性關懷，則經濟學自無愧為社會科學之母，其訓練目標亦與通識教育的人格均衡發展目的一致！為避免陷入一般經濟教學因理論工具比重過高而失焦，導致學生學習興趣驟減以致成效不彰，本課程重點在於先讓學生擁有強烈之學習動機，接著認知到"確立學習目的"的重要性，藉由生活實例直接帶領學生面對並感受問題，從而引導出經濟學切入問題的思維方式，並傳授其正確可行的學習態度與方法，同時提醒學生維持對專業知識批判的精神，在嚴謹訓練架構下督促其尋求感性的意涵，因而不致陷入經濟工具與名詞的浩瀚泥沼中，從而漸進體會出經濟學之精髓。
description.en: The science of economics is characterized by logics and cautious reasoning-at which most of the students of natural science and technology are good at. It is also a fact that those who take better advantage of the right brain are very likely to be straightforward and thus seemingly more mechanical and unsympathetic. Economics can be seen as the mother of science under the condition that rational efficiency-as well as the socially humanity--are kept at the same time. As a matter of act, the economic trainings share the same goal as what is required by the General Education courses.The first priority of the course is to highly motivate the students in the economic issues. We do our best to avoid too much weight generally put into teaching economics, leading to poor learning and teaching experience. Cases are studied in such a way that students will recognize the "real purpose of studying."  Real cases and examples are brought into discussion. We guide the students to"feel"the problems.

description.zh: 此門課程主要在於瞭解社會學的意涵，並藉由跨領域的學習，讓不同學科能有對話的空間。課程涵蓋的範圍會兼顧理論與實用性，讓學生能思考當今的社會，理解到產生因素的多元性，並進而使個人眼界能更加開拓。期望學生於課程學習中能夠擁有更多對於整個社會的不同思維，以強化本身學科之所需，不但具有理論性深入的洞察力，也能引用到管理上實質的層面。
description.en: The purpose of this course is to understand sociology. Expect students' study can have more for the community as a whole different way of thinking, in order to strengthen their academic needs, not only has the theoretical depth of insight, but also on the substance applied to the management level.

description.zh: 本課程是為非專業學生所設計的哲學概論，介紹西洋哲學的起源、西洋哲學的問題，以及哲學與人生的關係。哲學的問題意識起自人類的自覺，人類意圖認識自己，為宇宙人生尋求解答，哲學的發生本自人類天賦的求知欲，即其本性中對於智慧的追求與愛慕。這種愛慕智慧的精神是希臘文明留給西方世界的遺產，對於知識能持客觀批判的精神，對於真理能存認真熱切的態度，對於人生能有超克苦難的修持。在國際化的世代，我們對西方的認識應更深入其精神層面，此乃本課程規劃的初衷。
description.en: This course is designed for student who is not disciplined in philosophy. As an introduction, we begin at the origin of western philosophy, the philosophical questions and finally, the relationship of human life and philosophy. Philosophy takes place when human being thinking of himself. Man by nature desire to know himself as well as the external world. And due to this love of wisdom, men can be critical to knowledge and be passionate toward truth. Eventually, grasping the sprit of western philosophy , we can view our life in quite a different view. In our time, facing the world of international, we should better understand the western culture, which is rooted in philosophy.

description.zh: 倫理學(Ethics)是討論「應不應該」的一門哲學分支。倫理學可分為「微觀倫理學」：探討個人性之行為的應不應該的問題，以及「宏觀的倫理學」：探討整個社會的政治、經濟、法律、社會等方面的問題。倫理學亦可區分為「規範倫理學」及「應用倫理學」兩大類，前者探討善的定義與判斷準則、動機論與結果論、人的意志是否自由、決定論與責任、自律與他律、幸福與快樂、哪些德行(virtue)值得追求等等課題，後者則是運用倫理學觀點探討諸如安樂死、墮胎、環保、複製人等種種課題。本課程主要目的是在對倫理學課題與種類作一個基本的介紹，訓練及培養學生在倫理問題上思考的能力，期能讓學生在作道德問題的判斷與抉擇上能夠有所進步。
description.en: This course will introduce basic ideas of Ethics to students. The topics will include: the definition and criterion of good, motivation and consequence, the problem of free will, determinism and responsibility, autonomy and discipline by others, happiness and pleasure, and virtues. This course will also touch upon those issues in applied Ethics, such as abortion, environment, business ethics, death sentence, etc.

description.zh: 本課程首先說明人在宇宙中的定位、生命的可貴、一生的方向；接著說明如何鍛鍊自己成為生命的勇士；最後強調如何與天地萬物和諧相處和真愛的永不止息。課程進行方式是透過體驗活動、交流分享和有次第的講授人類共同的智慧，並安排數次的校外教學，以深入瞭解社會脈動，並運用多媒體影片教學以提升學習效果，學生每天做身心觀察學習紀錄，更可以看到生命進步的軌跡。
description.en: This course covers topics such as: the role of human beings in the universe, the dearness of life and the pursuit of life-long goals. We then discuss ways to train the students to become brave and to harmonize human beings with the nature, leading to an access to the discovery of true love.The course is realized through activity involvement, experience sharing and lectures on human wisdom. We have some extramural visits in order to understand social pulses. Multimedia teaching materials are fully utilized to enhance the teaching and learning effects. We request that all the students take note of their mental and physical improvements on a daily basis so that they could examine the progressive path of life.

description.zh: 本課程是為非專業學生所設計的哲學概論，介紹西洋哲學的起源、西洋哲學的問題，以及哲學與人生的關係。哲學的問題意識起自人類的自覺，人類意圖認識自己，為宇宙人生尋求解答，哲學的發生本自人類天賦的求知欲，即其本性中對於智慧的追求與愛慕。這種愛慕智慧的精神是希臘文明留給西方世界的遺產，對於知識能持客觀批判的精神，對於真理能存認真熱切的態度，對於人生能有超克苦難的修持。在國際化的世代，我們對西方的認識應更深入其精神層面，此乃本課程規劃的初衷。
description.en: This course is designed for student who is not disciplined in philosophy. As an introduction, we begin at the origin of western philosophy, the philosophical questions and finally, the relationship of human life and philosophy. Philosophy takes place when human being thinking of himself. Man by nature desire to know himself as well as the external world. And due to this love of wisdom, men can be critical to knowledge and be passionate toward truth. Eventually, grasping the sprit of western philosophy , we can view our life in quite a different view. In our time, facing the world of international, we should better understand the western culture, which is rooted in philosophy.

description.zh: 台灣的歷史從無文字傳統的原住民起，到17世紀西班牙、荷蘭海上競逐開始，漢人隨之移墾台灣，成為這塊土地最主要的住民。本課程的內容將依時間先後，將荷蘭西班牙殖民時期、鄭氏王國、清代台灣、日治時期與國民政府時期重要歷史大事、人物等依據講義講解，內容有政治、宗教、文化、經濟、社會等各層面的重要事件、人物以及歷史發展。
description.en: The history of Taiwan originated from the aboriginal culture in which no written languages were included. In the 17th century when the Spanish and the Netherlands were competing for the maritime power, the Hans immigrated into the island and became the main resident. The course will be taught in the temporal order: colonial periods under the Spanish and the Netherlands, Zheng's Kingdom, Taiwan under the Qing Dynasty, Taiwan under the Japanese Domination and Taiwan under the Nationalist Government. All the significant events and important figures will be discussed in class--on politics, religion, culture, economy and social development.

description.zh: 本課程的設計以歷史趨勢的闡述及專題研究分析二方面同時進行。課程方面包括中、西歷史觀念的比較與中國歷代政治、經濟、社會、文化的歷史演進，藉以幫助學生認識時代之趨勢與意義。授課方式以口頭講述為主，討論及書面報告為輔，期使學生在短時間內，能對中國歷史有一簡要而清晰的了解，深化學生的歷史感。
description.en: Methodologically, the course is performed in two ways at the same time: interpretation of historical trends as well as the study and analysis of specific topics. The course will cover: comparison of historical concepts and the historical development of a long term of Chinese history in the fields of politics, economics, society and culture so that the students who take this course will sure understand better the trends and significance as the historical time spans go by. Class activities are made up of: lectures, student discussion and paper presentation. The students who take this course will have a brief but clear understanding of the Chinese history in a short time-thus embedding themselves with a deeper sense of history.

description.zh: 多元文化不僅是當今世界的主流人文思維，也代表一種普世價值觀，更是全球人類彼此互動往來--地球村的基調。這門課主要是引導學生探討文化的意義，以及文化史的內涵，希望在有限的時間內，重點式的的介紹世界各主要國家的文化特色，經由對異文化的認識與比較，能夠協助學生建立較寬闊而多元的文化認知及價值取向。
description.en: Multi-culture is emerging as the mainstream field of humanities, involving not only a representation of universalism but also an interwoven tapestry of cross-cultural communication, which forms the fundamental structure of a global village. This course is to inspire students to search for the meaning of distinct cultures as well as the essence of cultural.

description.zh: 本課程主要在介紹中華民國憲法、探討憲政體制的運作、人民權利義務的規範及相關法律的適用等問題。期能使學生認知國家民主法治的實施狀況，維護社會秩序與個人基本權利，進而體現人性尊嚴的價值。
description.en: This course focuses the discussions on the Constitution of the Republic of China,constitutional mechanism, the rights and obligations for the people and legitimate operations of the society. It is our hope that the students may have a better understanding on how the democracy is performed in our country as well as on how to preserve social security and basic human rights of the individuals-with the realization of human dignity as our extreme goal.

description.zh: 法學概論，顧名思義是在介紹法律原理，以啟發學生法學研究的興趣。然而，法學涵蓋的層面甚廣，法學緒論的課程，只能大略介紹各種法律的共通原理，就繁駁的法律現象，作綜合的引說，俾使初學法律的人，不僅能粗知「實定法」的共通原則，還可藉此原則來培養法律見解和修養，執簡馭繁，因而體會法律的性質、內涵和理念。有關本課程的教授方式，擬先介紹法律的基概念及原理，並以答問之方式訓練學生邏輯反思的能力，同時輔以日常屢見之法律實例問題。如此，學生不僅可以可以學習正確的法律觀念和知識，並可培養縝密思辨的能力，將課堂上所習得的知識應用落實在日常生活中，以達保障並維護自己及他人權益之目的。
description.en: Introduction of Law is to introduce the theory of law and to promote students' interest to study law. Since the field of law is very broad but the time is limited, this course can briefly explain common principles of law, complex phenomena of law, etc. The main purpose of this course is to let students catch the concept of common principles of "lex scripta."  Also, this course aims to promote students' knowledge about law, thus cultivating their spirit of abiding by law.  This course will introduce the basic concept and theory of law first. Then students will be given logical training through discussion.  Besides, the general cases and problems of law will be covered as well. Through this course, students can not only get correct concepts of law, but learn to protect their/others' right.

description.zh: 新經濟與舊經濟的分野不是在有『e』還是沒有『e』，而是在有『i』還是沒有『i』，而『i』就是『Innovation，創新』。二十一世紀的『腦力經濟』最重要的戲規則就是『智慧財產權』，同時也是WTO會員國必須遵守的重要規範之一。課程內容主要包括三個最基本的智慧財產權課題：專利權，商標權，以及著作權；而為配合本校學生學科背景，本課程將較著重於『專利』方面的實務知識，並且講授『如何激發創意，以培養學生日後能好好應用『智慧財產權』的保護。
description.en: The difference between New-economy and Old-economy is not caused by having "e" or not having "e", but caused by owining "i" or not owning "i". where "I" means "Innovation:.  Intellectual Property is not only the most importance business rule of the :Brain economy era:, but also one of the most important agreements among WTO members.  This course includes the basic three subjects of Intellectual Property:Patent, Trademark, and Copyright.  In order to accommodate the learning background for most of NTUT students, the contents of this course will focus more on the practical practice of the Patennt.  In addition, it also includes the subject of "how to activate your creativeness:so as to make students can use what they learn, "Intellectual Property:, to protect their intellectual work.

description.zh: 學習"邏輯推理"主要的目的便是幫助我們培養一種邏輯能力，使我們能夠為我們的人生做出正確的判斷。本課程包括:邏輯的基本觀念，真值表推論法，語句邏輯中自然演繹法的18條基本推論規則，語句邏輯的基本公理系統，量化邏輯中自然演繹法的基本規論推測，量化邏輯的詮釋方法，量化邏輯的基本公理系統，語句邏輯的後設理論，量化邏輯的後設理論，傳統的三段論法，謬誤理論、與介於自然與形式語言之間的翻譯等等。
description.en: The main purpose of studying "Logical Inference" is to help us obtain a kind of logical ability, by means of which we will be able to make right choices for our life.  This courses covers at least the following topics: basic ideas in logic, the truth table method, 18 basic rules of inference in the method of natural deduction in sentential logic, basic axiomatic systems in sentential logic, basic rules of inference in the method of natural deduction in quantificational logic, interpretations in quantificational logic, basic axiomatic systems in quantificational logic, meta-theorem in sentential logic, meta-theorem in quantificational logic, traditional syllogism, the fallacy theory, and the translation between natural and formal language, etc.

description.zh: 現代科技文明進展得非常迅速，這使得一般人日常生活中，可能經常享受到這些科技所帶來的便利，但卻習以為常，以為天生下來就是這樣的，這些現代的科技，可能是關於電機的、物理的、化工的、光電的、材料的......，更有可能同時涉及了其他許多個領域，更可能有許多人希望能夠了解這些科技的來龍去脈，一窺其究竟，人類在沒有土木工程學之前，早已能建築萬里長城和金字塔，許許多多的科技是由嘗試錯誤，經驗的累積逐漸得來的，當然，隨著知識的不斷窮究其理，"知而後行"的高科技也就會越來越多，我們在這裡也試圖去追蹤各項科技的演進史與現況方面讓大家知道羅馬不是一天所造成的，另一方面也讓大家有從另一個角度重新思考的機會，也許這些科技進化到現在，還稱不上成熟的階段，您也許可以找出另一種更好的方法來改進它們！
description.en: Modern technology is growing fast. People thus enjoy the convenience in company with the technology—which they do and they just take it for granted to do. It may have something to do with electrical engineering, physics, chemical engineering, electro-optical engineering, materials…Some problems involves more than one field. People are curious about the technology and willing to know how to solve the problems. Human beings are able to build the pyramids and the Long Walls before they know anything about civil engineering—knowledge actually piled up by trial and error or accumulated experience. As knowledge expands, hi-end technology which requires “know-how” becomes more popular. In this course, we try to trace the history and the current situations: “Rome was not built in a day.” On the other hand, we might take another chance to RE-think a deeper problem: technology evolves without getting to maturity. Human beings will be enforced to find some other ways to improve it.

description.zh: 生命科學概論，重心放在人體生命科學，並強化醫學的角色。此外，中西醫結合的觀點，詮釋抗老、防癌。以身心靈養生的方式，強化預防醫學。並從人類疾病的本源性病因，根本探討。當然，如何增強免疫力，袪除自由基是主軸。在探究人體潛能、身心靈養生或疾病的本源性原因時，都必須重視「經絡」系統。總之生命是非常奧妙的，不僅只物質面，更要重視心靈層面，中西醫整合方向，必是廿一世紀的主流。
description.en: This course focuses on human life science and emphasizes the roles of medicine on improving the life quality of human beings. It also uses the point of view of integration traditional Chinese and western medicine to interpret how to prevent the aging of body and occurrence of cancers. This course also focuses on how to keep the body, mind and spirit in the best conditon in order to prevent the occurrence of human diseases. In addition, it deeply discusses the eseential etiology of human disease and teaches audiences how to enhance the body immunity and how to get rid of free radicals. The importance of meridian system of the human body and its relationships to human potentiality, body, mind spirit and diseses are also discussed. Life is marvelous. The completeness of life depends on the saisfaction of not only the material but also menetal and spiritual needs. Integration of the traditional Chinese and western medicine to improve the life quality of human beings is the main issue.

description.zh: 現代科技文明進展得非常迅速，這使得一般人日常生活中，可能經常享受到這些科技所帶來的便利，但卻習以為常，以為天生下來就是這樣的，這些現代的科技，可能是關於電機的、物理的、化工的、光電的、材料的......，更有可能同時涉及了其他許多個領域，更可能有許多人希望能夠了解這些科技的來龍去脈，一窺其究竟，人類在沒有土木工程學之前，早已能建築萬里長城和金字塔，許許多多的科技是由嘗試錯誤，經驗的累積逐漸得來的，當然，隨著知識的不斷窮究其理，"知而後行"的高科技也就會越來越多，我們在這裡也試圖去追蹤各項科技的演進史與現況方面讓大家知道羅馬不是一天所造成的，另一方面也讓大家有從另一個角度重新思考的機會，也許這些科技進化到現在，還稱不上成熟的階段，您也許可以找出另一種更好的方法來改進它們！
description.en: Modern technology is growing fast. People thus enjoy the convenience in company with the technology—which they do and they just take it for granted to do. It may have something to do with electrical engineering, physics, chemical engineering, electro-optical engineering, materials…Some problems involves more than one field. People are curious about the technology and willing to know how to solve the problems. Human beings are able to build the pyramids and the Long Walls before they know anything about civil engineering—knowledge actually piled up by trial and error or accumulated experience. As knowledge expands, hi-end technology which requires “know-how” becomes more popular. In this course, we try to trace the history and the current situations: “Rome was not built in a day.” On the other hand, we might take another chance to RE-think a deeper problem: technology evolves without getting to maturity. Human beings will be enforced to find some other ways to improve it.

description.zh: 本課程是為非專業學生所設計的哲學概論，介紹西洋哲學的起源、西洋哲學的問題，以及哲學與人生的關係。哲學的問題意識起自人類的自覺，人類意圖認識自己，為宇宙人生尋求解答，哲學的發生本自人類天賦的求知欲，即其本性中對於智慧的追求與愛慕。這種愛慕智慧的精神是希臘文明留給西方世界的遺產，對於知識能持客觀批判的精神，對於真理能存認真熱切的態度，對於人生能有超克苦難的修持。在國際化的世代，我們對西方的認識應更深入其精神層面，此乃本課程規劃的初衷。
description.en: This course is designed for student who is not disciplined in philosophy. As an introduction, we begin at the origin of western philosophy, the philosophical questions and finally, the relationship of human life and philosophy. Philosophy takes place when human being thinking of himself. Man by nature desire to know himself as well as the external world. And due to this love of wisdom, men can be critical to knowledge and be passionate toward truth. Eventually, grasping the sprit of western philosophy , we can view our life in quite a different view. In our time, facing the world of international, we should better understand the western culture, which is rooted in philosophy.

notes: 博雅核心-哲學,限外籍生修讀

description.zh: 本課程包含用於移植、非移植和體外的材料。移植的材料包含縫線、人工血管、人工心臟、人工骨頭、韌帶、藥物徐放裝置、人工皮膚、人工肝臟等。非移植的材料有醫療用衣服、繃帶、注射器材、診療用材料等。體外的材料包含透析膜、人工肺、人工導管等。
description.en: Biomaterials is an introductory course designed for biomaterial compositions, manufacture, functionality and implantability. Biomaterials included in the course are sutures, vascular grafts, artificial organs, artificial tissues,etc. In addition, biocompatibility, biodegradability, carcinogenicity and toxicity of biomaterials are presented in detail.

description.zh: 基因體學工程學，是結合分子生物技術及電腦資訊科技的新領域。由於分子生物技術的快速發展，DNA定序的資料也在近幾年中以驚人的速度產生；而這大量的資料經由電腦資訊的整理分析，所延伸出來的知識，已被廣泛地運用在生物醫學上的研究。基因體學工程學，是現代生物科技必要的知識。
description.en: Genomic engineering is a newly developed field joining the knowledge from molecular biology and computational technology. Molecular biology techniques in high speed screening such as DNA sequencing have generated large amount of data.  From these data, new frontier in biomedical researches can be explored. Genomic engineering is one of the essential discipline of biotechnology。

description.zh: 本課程包含用於移植、非移植和體外的材料。移植的材料包含縫線、人工血管、人工心臟、人工骨頭、韌帶、藥物徐放裝置、人工皮膚、人工肝臟等。非移植的材料有醫療用衣服、繃帶、注射器材、診療用材料等。體外的材料包含透析膜、人工肺、人工導管等。
description.en: The material in this course covers implantable, nonimplantable, and extracorporeal materials. Implantables include sutures, vascular grafts, artificial heart, artificial bones and ligaments, drug delivery device, artificial tissues, artificial liver,etc. Nonimplantable materials are : cloths in medical uses,  surgical dressings and gauze, injection device, diagonsis materials, etc. Extracorporeal materials are : dialysis fibers, artificial lung, catheters, etc.

description.zh: 分子生物學主要藉由分子的方法來探討細胞的生成、組成、功能及相互間之作用。因此此課程會含概以下四大部分：1. 細胞之簡介2. 分子基因學3. 細胞之內部組成4. 細胞間之生長，交互作用之影響
description.en: Molecular Biology is chiefly concentrated with eucaryotic cells and its title reflects the prime importance of the insights that have come from the molecular approach. This course will cover the following four different parts.1. Introduction to the cell2. Molecular genetics3. Internal organization of the cell4. Cells in their social context

description.zh: 探討印刷媒體（報紙、雜誌）、放映性媒體與電子媒體（Facebook、Blog）之特性，及英文在各類媒體應用之道；培養學生科技、商業、及教學媒體之賞析與應用能力。
description.en: This course is designed to help explore some of the important properties of the media: printing press , projective and electronic as well as the applied approaches of English in diverse media. The ability to enjoy and apply various types of media, including those on technology, business or teaching is among the course objectives.

description.zh: 本課程著重於如何將研究成果轉化成有市場價值的商品，使企業增加競爭優勢的過程。研究成果商品化是一長期且複雜的過程，需要研究創新、產品商業化、市場潛力評估、顧客行為分析與行銷策略等面向，才能確保商品化過程的順利進行，課程將說明商品化過程中所面臨的挑戰與可採行策略，在構想階段就可以評估商品的市場價值，如何設計行銷組合，說明研究成果商品化發展與上市過程與策略。
description.en: This course is original of research results transform into marketable products. And it wants to increase the competitive advantage of business. The commercialization of  research results is a long and complex process. The course explain the commercialization process will face the challenges and the strategies being adopted. In the conceptual stage to  assess the market value of commodities, as well as how to design marketing strategy and mix, the commercialization of research results development and listing process and strategy.

notes: 電機所、電通所、資工所、光電所合開

description.zh: 本課程將介紹下列內容：1.輻射度學基本參數介紹2.光度學基本參數介紹- 流明、燭光、勒克斯、尼特3.光的量測 - 總光功率量測、光強角分布、4.光譜量測、色溫量測、演色性量測5.TracePro軟體介紹6.Lightpipe導光管模擬7.LED配光曲線模擬範例8.LED混色照明設計實例9.室內照明標準 與 照明規畫10.道路照明 與 CIE道路照明標準
description.en: Outline：1.Radiometry 2.Photometry - lm, cd, lux, nit3.Light Measurement - Total flux, Intensity distribution, 4.Spectrum measurement -- CCT, CRI5.Luminaries Angular profile and design example6.Interior illumination standard7.CIE Road lighting standard8.Introduction to Dialux software 9.Case study:  LED Lighting Design Using TracePro10.Case study:  Road Lighting Design Using TracePro11.Case study:  LCD Backlight Lighting Design Using TracePro12.Case study:  Head Light Lighting Design Using TracePro

notes: 四光四、光電所和最後一哩合開,大學部限5人選修

description.zh: 本課程將介紹下列內容：1.輻射度學基本參數介紹2.光度學基本參數介紹- 流明、燭光、勒克斯、尼特3.光的量測 - 總光功率量測、光強角分布、4.光譜量測、色溫量測、演色性量測5.TracePro軟體介紹6.Lightpipe導光管模擬7.LED配光曲線模擬範例8.LED混色照明設計實例9.室內照明標準 與 照明規畫10.道路照明 與 CIE道路照明標準
description.en: Outline：1.Radiometry 2.Photometry - lm, cd, lux, nit3.Light Measurement - Total flux, Intensity distribution, 4.Spectrum measurement -- CCT, CRI5.Luminaries Angular profile and design example6.Interior illumination standard7.CIE Road lighting standard8.Introduction to Dialux software 9.Case study:  LED Lighting Design Using TracePro10.Case study:  Road Lighting Design Using TracePro11.Case study:  LCD Backlight Lighting Design Using TracePro12.Case study:  Head Light Lighting Design Using TracePro

notes: 光電所和最後一哩合開,研究所限10人選修

description.zh: 本課程重點在於台灣專利法的主要法律議題，包括產業利用性、新穎性、進步性、可實施性、說明書支持性、請求項不明確性、請求項解釋、侵權行為、救濟手段、專利授權、強制授權、專利訴訟之展開和舉發。本課程教材包括專利法教科書、智慧局頒發的專利審查基準和智慧財產法院裁判。
description.en: This course focuses on the main legal issues of the Taiwan Patent Law including industrial utility, novelty, inventive step, enablement, written description, claim indefiniteness, claim interpretation, infringement, remedies, patent licensing, compulsory licensing, initiation of patent litigation, and opposition. The class materials include a patent law textbook, patent examination guidelines issued by the Taiwan Intellectual Property Office and recent decisions from the Taiwan Intellectual Property Court.

description.zh: 為保障著作人著作權益，調和社會公共利益，促進國家文化發展，國家特制定著作權法；本課程重心在於介紹我國著作權法之內涵，包含該法所保護之「著作」範圍、權利人及著作權範圍、著作權管理及權利侵害之救濟等，除講授理論外，同時搭配案例解析，以期讓同學對著作權法有最完整之了解。
description.en: Copyright Act is specifically enacted for the purposes of protecting the rights and interests of authors with respect to their works, balancing different interests for the common good of society, and promoting the development of national culture. This course introduces the main meanings, concepts and contents of the Copyright Law. Including the scope for copyright protection, the kinds of works that qualify for copyright protection, the rights granted to copyright owners, the management of copyright, and remedies for right infringement. The discussion in the course covers theory and examples, to enhance a deeper understanding of Copyright for the students.

description.zh: 為保障商標權及消費者利益，維護市場公平競爭，促進工商企業正常發展，國家特制定商標法，本課程以介紹我國商標法為重點，主要內容包括商標規範之基本原理、商標之構成要素、商標之分類方式及各類型商標之特性與功能、申請商標註冊之程序、商標註冊之審查及核准、商標權之取得及行使、異議程序及紛爭處理、權利侵害之救濟等。
description.en: Trademark Act is formulated to safeguard trademark rights and the consumers' interest, maintain fair competition of markets, and facilitate normal development of industries and commerce. This course is focusing on the introduction of Trademark Act. Topics will mainly include the basic principle of trademark standard, the integrant part of trademark, the characteristic and the function of trademark, the application procedures, examination and approval, acquisition of the trademark rights and exercises, the procedure of opposition and the dispute processes, remedies for right infringement and so on.

description.zh: 以CAD繪圖軟體為教學範本，熟悉及應用繪圖指令，繪製機械之二度、三度空間的機械圖形，並能充分應用電腦的功能，以達輔助機械製圖及電腦輔助設計為目標。
description.en: Prerequisite: ME151 or Consent of InstructorUse commercial CAD softwares (e.g.: Turbo CAD or Auto CAD) as the tutorial examples for Mechanical Drawings, including 2-D and 3-D drawings, to edit and to modify the Menu, Script and Block etc..

description.zh: 先修課程：負責教授同意。變分法（ Weighted Residual法、Rayleih-Ritz 法等）、一維、二維及三維常用有限元素模型推演、介紹、元素內插(Interpolation)、積分、元素及總體矩陣、收歛及誤差、特徵值等、有限元素法於工程上之應用 (線性固態及結構問題為例)、商用軟體介紹。
description.en: Weighted Residual Method, Rayleigh-Ritz Method, Constant Strain Elements, Plane Strain and Stress Elemental and Global Matrix Formation, Convergence and Error, Eigenvalue Problems, Application to Engineering (Solid Mechanics and Structural Systems), and Commercial Packages.

description.zh: 讀書報告、專題討論、機電系統產品介紹與討論、Seminar心得等。可重覆修習。
description.en: Case Study, Mechatronics in Industry, Seminars.

name.zh: 高等材料性質學與實習
name.en: Advanced Properties of Materials and Related Practice

description.zh: 本課程將深入的討論材料之光電及表面性質，並經由實習實驗量測各種相關特性。尤其是在材料電子理論的應用方面。所涵蓋的主題包括有：電子理論、光學特性、繞射理論、表面科學、以及材料之磁性與熱力學性質。
description.en: After successfully completing this subject a student should be able to: (i) explain the fundamental aspects of electrical properties of materials, (ii) describe and understand energy method, (iii) describe and discuss nanoscale properties of materials, (iv) apply advanced properties of materials to engineering design problems, and (v) execute related measurements.

description.zh: 讓學生習得3D 材質編修電腦軟體之技能，俾能將工業設計產品進行材質模擬與色彩計劃。
description.en: The study of materials edit computer software which could apply materials simulation and color plan on industrial design products.

description.zh: 講授工程圖之基本原理及規則，並佐以必要之工程設計知識與AutoCAD繪圖技巧,培養學生具備熟練與有效率地將設計構想以工程圖方式正確表達的能力。
description.en: An introductory course providing the student with fundamental information, understanding and skills mainly in orthographic projection. Theories and principles of engineering drawing will be specifically introduced and concurrent with the practice of drafting for industrial design.

description.zh: 建立設計專業用德文基礎；德文發音、拼音、基本句型、詞類文法及設計專業德文導讀，用以唸讀及理解設計專業相關德文。
description.en: Introducing the alphabet pronunciation, phonation, sentence structures and the ten parts speech grammar of German to building the capability of reading and understanding the design based German.

description.zh: 建立設計專業用德文基礎；德文發音、拼音、基本句型、詞類文法及設計專業德文導讀，用以唸讀及理解設計專業相關德文。
description.en: Introducing the alphabet pronunciation, phonation, sentence structures and the ten parts speech grammar of German to building the capability of reading and understanding the design based German.

description.zh: 從人類、社會、人文學上探討人性、設計倫理與資源、經濟之關係，建立設計之推行及正確理念。
description.en: Lecture on the development of prime influences on design domestically and internationally, with emphasis on the work of key industrial designers. Discussion sessions with reading assignments will be carried out through the course, and submission of a written report is required.

name.zh: 逆向工程與快速原型（一）
name.en: Reverse Engineering and  Rapid prototyping Practice （一）

description.zh: 從點群掃描、建構曲面、實體、分析與檢測並轉出Stl檔等逆向工程流程到快速原型加工原理、系統分類做實務介紹與製造
description.en: This subject is arranged to introduce the principles and techniques used in Reverse Engineering (RE). The subject includes the following subtopics: introduction of RE, 3D measurement principles, surface digitization strategies, curve and surface modeling and the introduction of rapid prototyping system.

name.zh: 室內設計與裝修證照概論
name.en: License of Interior Design and Decoration

description.zh: 整合學科與術科兩大部分，本課程介紹【建築物室內設計】與【建築物室內裝修工程管理】專業技能檢定事宜。參酌最新專業議題並研習歷屆考試題庫，課程加強學／術科模擬考試訓練，期使學校養成教育與設計界之專業需求得以結合。
description.en: Integrating the Knowledge and Technology parts of the Interior design profession, the course introduces the practice of National Skill Test of Interior design and Project Management. Concerning not just the updated ideas and the historical questions, it stresses also the intensive stimulated test so as to link the educational achievement and the professional expectation.

name.zh: 創意城市與城市規劃專論
name.en: Special Topics on Creative City and City Planning

description.zh: 目前全世界超過一半以上的人口生活在城市，人數仍快速增加中，相伴而來的環境、經濟、社會與治理問題將如何處理？因此城市轉型是城市要繼續成長的必要過程，許多案例顯示創意城市是城市轉型的典範，可以作為城市轉型與再生的契機。創意城市是近年來先進國家鼓勵領導者、產業、市民從己身城市內思考、規劃、發揮創意與實現城市創新的觀念，以啟發城市找到自身的發展潛能，結合當地文化資產及地方特色，經由城市發展規劃提升創意經濟及城市的競爭力。本課程以文化創意、產業創新及城市規劃為主軸，包括研究創意城市定義、特徵、條件、構成、指標、類型、評估的基礎，進而探討與文化創意、產業創新、城市發展規劃的關連，並參考國內外城市的創新與再生案例，他們是如何在城市議題上思考、規劃與執行富有創意的行動，又如何將行動運用於城市規劃。課程經由互動分析創意城市與城市規劃的關連及作法，討論可供借鏡的發展策略與方案。
description.en: The creative city is crucial to urban transformation in the future of our city. It means to encourage leaders,industries, and citizens to think, plan, create and realize urban innovation, inspired by the city to find their own development potential, combined with local cultural assets and characteristics, to enhance the creative economy through urban development planning and the city's competitiveness. The course aims at framing cultural creativity, industrial innovation and urban planning as main thoughts on the basis of research. Literature review including definition, characteristics, conditions, indicators, types of assessment, and then to explore with the cases of innovation and regeneration around the world. How they think urban issues, planning and implementation on creative actions, and how the actions used in urban planning.Courses via interactive analysis among the creative city,urban planning and practices,to figure out development strategies and programs available to learn.

description.zh: 為追求「永續發展與人本健康」之目的，使既有與新建的居住環境，配合我國「室內空氣品質管理法」規範下運作，提昇民眾居住環境健康品質效益，針對病態建築之環境問題，其涵蓋醫療、法律、建築、化學、生物等領域，綜合診斷以進行改善。本課程為第一階段之系列課程，其內容包括： 一.健康環境概念：說明何謂「病態建築」，探討室內空氣與健康之關係。 二.建築物污染源：探討來自各建築材料的化學物質逸散及其對人體健康之影響，並提出室內污染物質濃度減低對策。 三.生物性污染源：探討黴菌、蹣、白蟻及寵物等帶來的室內空氣污染。 四.診斷技術：說明室內空氣品質診斷方法及病態建築改善之專業技術，配合案例介紹探討新、舊建築物室內環境品質的設計預防、診斷改善技術。
description.en: The main goal of this class is to pursue sustainable development and human health. In order to enhance the quality of residential and living environment in both existing and new-build dwellings, the course will cover important principles and topics in sick building environment, including medical, regulation, and architecture, chemical and biological. Specific contents include: (1)Conception of healthy environment: To explain the "sick building" and explore the association between indoor air and health.(2)Pollution source from buildings: To investigate the chemicals emission from building materials and their effect on human health, and get the countermeasures on reduce the indoor pollutants.(3)Pollution source from Biological: To investigate the indoor air pollution that cause by the mold, mites, termites, and pets.(4)Diagnostic techniques: To improved indoor air quality and sick building by diagnostic methods, with the case studies to prevent indoor environmental quality on new and old

notes: 建都所和設計博所合開

description.zh: 本課程目標在為本校碩博士班的同學做好英語終身學習的準備。確切學習要點：1.	建立個人英文資料檔案(含自傳、履歷、求職信件等)。2.	學習如何運用媒體與英語雜誌及廣播持續不斷地自我提升英文程度。3.	以活潑的上課方式(唱歌、短劇、演講、講笑話等)培養同學英語溝通表達的能力與膽量。4.	以閱讀英語學習雜誌培養閱讀能力，並藉由內容的深入討論擴大視野，了解全球現勢與重要議題。
description.en: The aim of this course is to help students (1) sharpen up their learning skills in English language/culture acquisition, (2) prepare a personal dossier (including autobiography, resume, CV and application letters) in English for their future career needs, (3) build up their communication skills through classroom activities, such as singing, reciting passages, short plays, small talks, and speeches.

name.zh: 問題分析,解決技巧與實例演練
name.en: Problem analysis, solving skills and practice

description.zh: 本課程介紹分析問題、解決問題的工具及手法。包括：管理性問題、IE問題、發明性問題的分析與解決技法等。例如：腦力激盪法、IE及品管七大手法、演進趨勢分析法、九宮格分析法、因果鏈分析法…等。本課程以問題與案例為主題，實際帶領學員運用工具及手法，學習問題的分析與解決。
description.en: The objectives of "Problem Analysis & Solving Skills" course are to study the systematic methods of analyzing and solving problem. The topics of this course includes concepts and context about analyzing and solving management problem, IE problem, and inventive problem , for examples "Brain Storming"、"IE & QC 7 Methods"、"Trends Analysis"、"9 Windows Analysis"、"CEC Analysis"…etc.

notes: 四工三和最後一哩合開

description.zh: 本課程從分子化學的觀點談述分子材料。其中包括原子結構及分子結構，基礎高分子化學，生物化學。
description.en: This course introduces molecular materials from chemistry point of view. It covers the following topics: structures of atoms and molecules, polymer molecules, and biochemistry.

description.zh: 一、教學目標：本課程旨在讓學生從實際學習華語、閩南語的吟唱詩歌入手，並藉由音韻之美，欣賞古典詩歌的文學美，且希能進而了解台灣傳統文化之特徵及其意義，加強人文精神之素養，培養尊重多元文化之心胸。二、教學大綱1.詩詞吟唱之文獻探討 2.吟唱理論之蒐集與整理 3.吟唱曲譜之蒐集與整理 4.吟唱視聽媒體之蒐集與整理 5.吟唱技巧之探討與練習 詩、詞、曲的吟唱、文的吟誦 6.吟唱教學實務之探討 7.分組資料蒐集成果報告 三、指定教材或參考書目：1.古詩詞文吟誦  陳少松著（北京社會科學文獻出版社）2.自編教材四、教學方式：1.吟唱理論及技巧部分以教師講授為主。2.學生分組資料蒐集、舉行吟唱學習成果觀摩表演，各組互評。五、評量方式： 1.分組資料蒐集成果為平時成績。 2.期中評量為課堂個人吟唱表演，期末評量為公開展演及筆試。
description.en: This course aims to enable students to start singing poetry from learning Mandarin, Taiwanese, and by the beauty of rhyme, appreciate the literature of classical poetry, and hope to be able to understand the characteristics of Taiwan's traditional culture and its significance, and to strengthen the qualities of the human spirit and cultivate a respect for cultural diversity.

description.zh: 本課程著重於資源再生分選廠的設計與規劃，如何選擇各項機械，並利用電腦程式輔助以達成建廠設計的知識。
description.en: The objective of this class is to teach student how to design a process plant to conduct industrial waste recycling and reutilization.  The process unit selection and computer modeling and simulation will also be included in the design process.

description.zh: 1.機率簡介 2.機率分佈 3.統計概論 4.抽樣分析 5.參數估計 6.區間估計 7.假設檢定 8.迴歸分佈 9.統計品管 10.變異分析
description.en: Introduction to probability Probability distribution Introduction to statistics Sampling analysis Quality control

description.zh: 相圖及相變化熱力學,多元溶液及部份莫耳熱力學。以熱力學分析.設計及電腦模擬冶金方法。
description.en: The thermodynamics of phase diagrams and phase transformations. Solution thermodynamics of multi-compoment and partial molar properties. Applications of thermodynamics to the analysis, design and computer simulation of metallurgical processes.

name.zh: 產業科技管理專題研究
name.en: Special Topics in Industrial Technology management

description.zh: 1.增進並充實同學對科技產業之認識 2.瞭解高科技公司生存之道-創新策略與管理 3.培養高科技公司經理人才
description.en: 1.Provide and enhance the knowlege of Science & Technolegy enterprise 2.Understand the rule of success of high tech. Company-Innovation Strategy and management 3.Cultivate high tech.Company manager

description.zh: 介紹陶瓷材料、不同成型技法、釉藥知識及燒窯過程。在課堂實習手捏成型、圈條成型、拉坏成型等多種不同成型方法及表面設計應用在陶瓷作品之練習。
description.en: This course aims to develop student's potential in ceramics and pottery making, and to encourage a practical and theoretical understanding of skills and techniques of pottery making process.

notes: 四設二三合開(陶藝教室),限15人

description.zh: 年來，在世博和花博兩大活動的帶動下，讓跨領域整合的「展示科技」成為新的研究焦點；新型態的展示手法，可以被應用在博物館及展場、商業空間、互動式機台、行銷活動和數位藝術。依照需求的不同，可以把展示科技分成『會場環境』和『觀眾體驗』兩類，前者就像是基礎建設、活動系統和周邊系統，而後者則是為觀眾創造全新體驗。而本課程則是為了掌握產業界相關的技術新知、學術界的專業研究與藝文界的脈動，本課程將廣邀展示科技的專家或學者，參與專題討論，就展場設計、互動技術、視覺呈現等面向，翻轉你與展示物的關係，體現創意展現的軟實力。
description.en: The promotion of Expo and Flora Expo in recent years makes the display technology a new focus in study. New pattern of display techniques can be applied to museum, exhibition, commercial space, interactive machinery, marketing and digital art. Depending on different needs, the Display Technology can be divided into two categories, which are "the environment of exhibition" and "the experience of audience". The former is like fundamental constructions, movable system, and peripheral system; the latter is like building a new and fresh experience for the audience. To understand science and technological information from business field, researches from academic field and issues from arts field, this course should be invited the expertise and scholars to participate the topic discussion.

description.zh: 科技的進步不僅利於人類文明的創新，也考驗當代法律制度是否能確保法正義的理念與法秩序的維持。本課程主要是探討我國與先進國家智慧財產權、公平交易法、消費者保護法、電子商務、網路犯罪與生物科技法律等問題。
description.en: The advance of technology facilitates an innovation of human civilization; in addition, it also proves to be a test of the modern legal system-seeing whether a balance between legal justice and legal order can be maintained. Some important topics available for class discussion are: intellectual property, fair trade law, consumer protection, e-commerce, internet crimes and biological technology.

description.zh: 本課程提供供應鏈中協同管理的重要多面向，探討供應商、零售商及終端消費者間腳色互動及運作，以及能促使供應鏈鄭和及協同之機制。課程目標在使(1) 在現今高度競合產業環境中，提供對整合及協同供應鏈的理解、專業管理及未來願景。(2) 提供學生具高階供應鏈管理者之必要認知及知識。
description.en: The course takes a broad view of the critical facets of supply chain coordination and management, expanding beyond internal company operations to include the suppliers, the retailers and the end consumers. Aligning supply chain management with integrated strategies and policies. The goal of the course is (a) to provide professionals with the vision and skill set necessary to understand and manage the integration and coordination of activities within today's increasingly complicated supply chains and (b) to equip students with the knowledge and perceptions demanded for supply chain management leaders today.

description.zh: 針對大學所習之廣義生產管理再作深入的闡述，一方面做公開的個案分析研討，以收進一步的學習之效，同時要求學生做實務專題研究
description.en: Production and operation management,case study and analysis,and independent study.

notes: 工管所和IMBA合開;工管所為選修,IMBA為必修

description.zh: 本課程包括概論、距離測量、水準測量、經緯儀測量、導線測量、平板儀測量、地形測量、礦區測量等。實習課程包括距離測量操作、水準測量操作、經緯儀測量、導線測量實作、平板儀測量實習、地形測量實習、礦區測量實習等
description.en: The surveying class includes general introduction, distance measurement, leveling measurement, theodolite, traversing, plane table surveying, topographical surveying and mine surveying. The surveying lab. is designed for student to operate various surveying equipment and instruments. It includes distance measuring, leveling measurement, theodolite, traversing surveying, plane table surveying, topographical surveying and mine surveying.

description.en: Course purpose:1. To describe how to use intellectual properties in medical device field2. To use patent information on medical device designs and to do the designing around3. To know patent value and IP managementTo understand how the medical device industry related to IP portfolio

description.en: (1) Plastic materials types, characteristics, and applications. (2) Forming methods of plastic materials. (3) Part design of injection molding. (4) Classification and specification of injection molding machine. (5) Mechanism of injection mold. (6) Injection mold's parts and part selection. (7) Defects and strategy.

name.zh: 人類聚落與風土建築專題
name.en: Seminar on Human Settlements and Vernacular Architecture

description.zh: 本課程將以「人造環境視為實相的再現」的研究範式為基礎，帶領學生以比較研究的觀點，進行跨地域與跨文化的人類聚落與風土建築之討論。世界各地的聚落與風土建築案例將從各種自然因素進行分析，例如氣候、地景、材料與構造等等；此外，其亦將從人類對於外在環境之心靈建構進行分析，包括「世界軸與宇宙十字」、「納入與排除的結構」與「聖域與非聖域」。透過這樣的分析，學生將可以理解人類聚落與風土建築的根本價值，這些價值也將必須落實在創造人類永續居住環境的過程中。
description.en: This course will teach students how to conduct inter-regional and inter-cultural research on the worldwide human settlements and vernacular architecture from a comparative perspective as based on the paradigm of the built environment as a representation of realities. Various examples of human settlements and vernacular architecture will be analyzed not only according to the natural factors (e.g. climate, landscape, material and tectonics) but also according to the mental constructs of the external environment (e.g. the "Axis Mundi & Cosmic Cross", the "Including & Excluding Structures" and the "Holy & Unholy Zones"). Such an analysis will enable students to understand the intrinsic values of human settlements and vernacular architecture that should be embodied in the establishment of a sustainable built environment for human beings.

description.zh: 探討身為設計師針對公共建築與空間的服務設計應有的素養與責任，研究台灣與其他地方相關公共建築與所提供的服務空間案例。
description.en: If you could improve one everyday experience in Taipei City, what would it be, and how would you do it?In this class, we ask: What's a service and how are good ones conceived and created? What can we, as designers, contribute to services for public buildings and space? What responsibilities do users as "citizens" rather than "customers" demand of designers? Drawing from my own interest in, research for, and links to,Taipei City agencies and service providers, we'll explore the kinds of relationships that services broker, and practice some key design processes and methods to understand how context of use, stakeholders, storytelling and mapping techniques shape services. In class and through assignments, we'll review a range of real life case studies in Taiwan and elsewhere.The class will be part seminar and part workshop. It's not a production class; instead, assignments will focus on written and sketching exercises, and reading. There will be opportunities to present, and, where succes
